page.title: 08Sutton Bingham Reservoir
page.content: The former Yeovil Borough Council completed the reservoir in 1954, on land purchased from farmers, etc; and the undertaking is now vested in the Wessex Water Authority. Where this land is not actually flooded, the farmers are able to lease it back, but there are very strict limitations on its use - no ploughing, grazing only by sheep, no herbicides nor nitrogenous fertilisers. The reservoir is quite attractively landscapd but unfortunately public access is extremely limited. Only anglers holding licences from the Water Authority are allowed on its banks (some also use boats). There are few places where the water can even be seen from the road, let alone approached. There is a sailing club which uses the lower (northern) end, but this is outside the block.
